evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My brand-new, shiny badge. It shows that I'm a defense attorney.* (when playing as Athena Cykes)
evidences.description2: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)

evidences.name: Arme's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Cause of death: Trauma to back of head caused by impact with a flat object. Time of death: Between 8 and 11 AM.

evidences.name: Stuffed Animal Bomb → HH-3000 Bomb
evidences.description1: The time bomb that destroyed the courtroom. It was hidden inside a stuffed animal when it was detonated.
evidences.description2: It was hidden inside a stuffed animal and can be detonated remotely.

evidences.name: Phony Phanty Tail
evidences.description1: A piece of the stuffed animal that the bomb was inserted into. The defendant's fingerprints were found on it.

evidences.name: Bomb Transport Case
evidences.description1: The case Tonate and Detective Arme transported the bomb in. Tonate has the key.

evidences.name: Missing Remote Switch
evidences.description1: A switch that starts the time bomb's countdown. It was stolen just before the blast and is now missing.

evidences.name: Courtroom No. 4 Diagram
evidences.description1: A diagram of the courtroom as it was when Apollo was discovered after the assault.

evidences.name: Apollo's Assault Photo
evidences.description1: Apollo is shown collapsed on the floor. The bloody writing is also visible.

evidences.name: Courtroom Bombing Photo
evidences.description1: Crime scene photo of the aftermath of the Courtroom No. 4 bombing and the victim.

evidences.name: Bloody Writing Analysis
evidences.description1: A report that proves that the writing was done in Detective Arme's blood.

evidences.name: Mr. Wright's Last Will
evidences.description1: "Apollo, sorry I got you caught up in all this. I leave the rest to you. Take good care of everyone, okay?"

evidences.name: Mr. Wright's Cell Phone
evidences.description1: The phone that delivered Mr. Wright's final message to me.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.

evidences.name: Yokai Legend Scroll
evidences.description1: A scroll depicting the demon Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox.
evidences.description2: The sole document showing what Tenma Taro looks like. It seems those who foolishly choose to depict the demon are cursed.

evidences.name: Tenma Taro Warding Charm
evidences.description1: The Tenma Taro warding charm that Jinxie gave me when I set out for the scene of the crime.

evidences.name: Nine-Tails Flower
evidences.description1: A flower found only in Nine-Tails Vale. It boosts Jinxie's courage because it was her mother's favorite.

evidences.name: Special Edition Paper
evidences.description1: A newspaper with a photo of Tenma Taro soaring through the air.

evidences.name: Crime Scene Diagram
evidences.description1: A diagram showing the scene of the crime.

evidences.name: Foyer Diagram
evidences.description1: A diagram of the foyer, including the office used by the caretaker, Phineas Filch.

evidences.name: Fox and Demon Statue
evidences.description1: A statue that was at the crime scene. It depicts Tenma Taro and the Nine-Tailed Fox locked in battle.
evidences.description2: The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. The mayor's blood was found on it, but no fingerprints could be lifted.
evidences.description3: The weapon used to bludgeon the mayor. Wrapped in a large cloth. (2 pages.)
evidences.description4: A token of goodwill made in secret. Jinxie is now the only one who knows what the original looked like.

evidences.name: Golden Fur
evidences.description1: Some fur that was found at the scene of the crime. It's long and soft, and appears to be from some animal.

evidences.name: Crime Photo
evidences.description1: A photo of the Fox Chamber. There are bloody footprints and black feathers scattered on top of the blood.

evidences.name: Amazing Nine-Tails Mask
evidences.description1: A mask that washed up by the riverside. There's white hair inside.
evidences.description2: A mask found washed up by the riverside. It might have been at the crime scene. White hair inside.

evidences.name: Amazing Nine-Tails Glossy
evidences.description1: A photo of the hero who sparked the monster craze and saved Nine-Tails Vale from becoming a ghost town.

evidences.name: Jinxie's Statement
evidences.description1: Jinxie's eyewitness account of the demon in the hallway near the crime scene. She says it fled toward the foyer.

evidences.name: TV Listings
evidences.description1: Filch's TV program guide. The afternoon wrestling match was a total disaster.

evidences.name: Kyubi's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Cause of death: Stabbed with a spear. Est. time of death: Around 3:20 PM. The victim had been in a drug-induced slumber.

evidences.name: Blackmail Letter
evidences.description1: A threatening letter discovered in one of Alderman Kyubi's pockets.
evidences.description2: The threatening letter sent to the mayor. It's highly likely that it was L'Belle who took it from the mayor's briefcase.

evidences.name: Village Superstitions
evidences.description1: Superstitions that have been handed down generation to generation in Nine-Tails Vale.

evidences.name: Forbidden Chamber Key
evidences.description1: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. No fingerprints could be lifted from it.
evidences.description2: The key that the mayor took from the killer and swallowed. There's only one of its kind.

evidences.name: Couleur Me L'Belle!
evidences.description1: Hair color that washes out with water. It's Florent L'Belle's own brand and isn't available to the general public.

evidences.name: Hand Cream
evidences.description1: An item that was dropped in the Forbidden Chamber. It bears the "Je suis L'Belle" logo.

evidences.name: Forbidden Chamber Figure → Azuki Kozo Figure
evidences.description1: A figure that had been left inside the Tenma Taro statue. A thick layer of dust and dirt suggests it had been there for some time.
evidences.description2: A figure discovered inside the Tenma Taro statue. Apparently, it's something a certain thief leaves at the scene of a theft.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My brand-new, shiny badge. It shows that I'm a lawyer.

evidences.name: Arrow
evidences.description1: The arrow that pierced the victim's side. It's stained with blood.

evidences.name: Courte's Planner
evidences.description1: Constance Courte's planner. A sword emblem is printed on the cover and on each page.

evidences.name: Themis Herald
evidences.description1: A school paper with a malicious scoop on an alleged love triangle involving Junie.

evidences.name: Stage Costume
evidences.description1: A costume Junie was supposed to wear. It has a glowing star pattern. (With notes, 2 pages.)

evidences.name: Mock Trial Script
evidences.description1: A top secret script written by Junie. There's only one copy. (4 pages.)

evidences.name: Themis Herald Extra
evidences.description1: An extra edition of the school paper that covers the mock trial.

evidences.name: Awl
evidences.description1: The weapon used to murder Constance Courte. Her blood was found on it along with Junie's fingerprints.

evidences.name: Courte's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Est. time of death: Between 6 and 8 PM. Cause of death: Blood loss from a deep stab wound in the victim's side.

evidences.name: Tape Recorder
evidences.description1: Used by Myriam to secretly record the conversation in the art room. A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!"
evidences.description2: A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!" Recorded in the art room at 7:10 PM on the 23rd.
evidences.description3: The voice on the tape says "You're a goner!" just like in Junie's script. It may be a fake.
evidences.description4: The voice on the tape says "You're a goner!" just like in Junie's script. It's been identified as a fake.
evidences.description5: Identified as a fake. Prof. Means used Hugh to pass it on to the police.

evidences.name: Glowing Costume Photo
evidences.description1: A photo of the stage costume taken in a dark room. A coat of fluorescent paint made it glow.

evidences.name: School Camera Photo
evidences.description1: A photo of the art room while preparations were being made. Taken on the day of the murder.

evidences.name: School Banner
evidences.description1: A large banner that was hung by a wire between the stage and art room. A trace amount of blood was found on it.

evidences.name: Purple Fragment → Purple Fragments
evidences.description1: A purple fragment from a broken statue. It was found all alone in the strangest of places.
evidences.description2: Two purple fragments of a broken statue. Going to search for more.
evidences.description3: Three purple fragments of a broken statue that originally stood on a pedestal onstage.

evidences.name: White Fragment → White Fragments
evidences.description1: A large, white fragment. It has a distinctive shape that could be described as angular.
evidences.description2: Two large, white fragments. It looks like it would feel good to break them.

evidences.name: Lady Justice
evidences.description1: This and the statue of Klavier were broken at the same time, but have been repaired. No one knows where it came from.
evidences.description2: It was found broken onstage. Professor Courte had remade it into a completely different-looking statue the day before the mock trial.

evidences.name: "Hugh" Scrap
evidences.description1: Discovered onstage, it appears to be a piece of paper torn from a notebook. The name "Hugh" is written on it.

evidences.name: Burnt Fragments
evidences.description1: The burnt remnants of the Gavinners banner that was tossed into the incinerator and later found by Myriam.

evidences.name: Stage Set Up Photos
evidences.description1: The last two of Myriam's photos. They show the students setting up the stage's backdrop on the night of the murder. (2 photos.)

evidences.name: Voiceprint Analysis
evidences.description1: The results of the voice analysis performed on the tape recording.

evidences.name: Lecture Hall Diagram
evidences.description1: A diagram of the lecture hall where the mock trial took place.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice)
evidences.description2: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)

evidences.name: Terran's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.

evidences.name: Space Center Diagram
evidences.description1: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.

evidences.name: Utility Knife
evidences.description1: The victim's blood was found on its blade, but no fingerprints could be lifted.
evidences.description2: It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs.

evidences.name: Bombing Report
evidences.description1: The explosions sparked a fire on the second floor of the main building and the middle level of the launch pad near the elevator.

evidences.name: Evacuation Report
evidences.description1: The bombs went off despite tight security. Police officers and riot police who had been standing by gave the evacuation instructions.

evidences.name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
evidences.description1: A biometric door lock operated by fingerprint recognition. Only the defendant, the victim, and the Space Center director had access.
evidences.description2: Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.)

evidences.name: Security Camera Video
evidences.description1: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor to the boarding lounge.
evidences.description2: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.

evidences.name: Oxygen Tank Data
evidences.description1: The victim's tank was ruptured, with 0% left. The defendant's had 80%. Remaining oxygen is displayed on left shoulder.
evidences.description2: The victim's oxygen tank was struck by a bullet.

evidences.name: Space Center Pamphlet
evidences.description1: A pamphlet for visitors to the Space Center. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge.
evidences.description2: It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)

evidences.name: Bullet Hole
evidences.description1: A single bullet hole was found in the boarding lounge. The bullet itself is missing.
evidences.description2: The only bullet hole found in the boarding lounge. It was made by a bullet fired from a .38-caliber gun.

evidences.name: Control Room Door Lock
evidences.description1: The door lock to the east. It can only be operated by the director. Backup power lets it function even when the power goes out.

evidences.name: Bullet
evidences.description1: Discovered in a gutter that runs along the south wall of the boarding lounge. It was fired from a .10 caliber handgun.

evidences.name: "Hope" Capsule
evidences.description1: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples.

evidences.name: Aura's Statement
evidences.description1: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.

evidences.name: Bullet from Arme's Gun
evidences.description1: The bullet found near the victim's oxygen tank. It was fired from a .38 caliber handgun.

evidences.name: Lighter
evidences.description1: The lighter found on the floor of the Space Museum. The true culprit's fingerprints are on it in the victim's blood.
evidences.description2: Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

evidences.name: Space Center Diagram
evidences.description1: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.

evidences.name: Utility Knife
evidences.description1: It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs.
evidences.description2: The murder weapon in this case. Athena also used one of these to stab the phantom's hand during the incident seven years ago.

evidences.name: Space Center Pamphlet
evidences.description1: It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)

evidences.name: "Hope" Capsule
evidences.description1: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples.
evidences.description2: It was at the crime scene seven years ago. It was launched into space and only returned to Earth a few days ago.

evidences.name: HAT-1 Exhibit
evidences.description1: A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and a jacket one of them wore.
evidences.description2: A newspaper clipping, a photo of the people involved with the launch, and the jacket worn by Dr. Cykes.

evidences.name: Katana
evidences.description1: The weapon used in the murder seven years ago. It belonged to the victim. The victim's blood was found only on the blade.

evidences.name: Seven-Year-Old Video
evidences.description1: Video showing the corridor to the crime scene. Blackquill was the only one to pass through at the time of the crime.

evidences.name: Photo of the Crime
evidences.description1: Taken inadvertently. It became conclusive evidence at Simon Blackquill's trial seven years ago.
evidences.description2: The photo shows Blackquill taking the robot apart. There's a bloodstain at the end of the robot's arm.

evidences.name: Seven-Year-Old Photos
evidences.description1: Two photos of the body and crime scene. They were taken by the first person to discover the body.

evidences.name: Metis's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: The cause of death was a stab wound to the chest. The weapon pierced the heart and so death was instantaneous.

evidences.name: Robots with a Heart
evidences.description1: It explains the recognition and communication features of the Ponco series of Robots.

evidences.name: Moon Rock Earring
evidences.description1: An earring that Dr. Cykes gave to Athena. The stone was cut from a real moon rock that was being used for research.

evidences.name: Phantom's Psych Profile
evidences.description1: The subject's emotions rarely fluctuate and he doesn't experience feelings like normal people do.

evidences.name: Terran's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.

evidences.name: Security Camera Video
evidences.description1: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.

evidences.name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
evidences.description1: Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.)
evidences.description2: The biometric door lock. Print authentication isn't required from the launch pad side. (2 pages.)

evidences.name: Aura's Statement
evidences.description1: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.

evidences.name: Lighter
evidences.description1: Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood.
evidences.description2: A lighter that can transform into a handgun. It has Clay Terran's fingerprints and blood on it.

evidences.name: Emergency Ladder
evidences.description1: It was lowered to the ground from the window of the fourth-floor robotics lab. It was used to evacuate Space Center personnel.

evidences.name: Phony Phanty Bomb
evidences.description1: It was found in Boarding Lounge 1 and detonated in Courtroom No. 4. Fragments are being analyzed. (2 pages.)

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

evidences.name: Swashbuckler Flyer
evidences.description1: An advertisement showing an orca dressed up like a pirate. It was dropped by a penguin.
evidences.description2: An advertisement for a new show. It was dropped by a penguin.
evidences.description3: An advertisement for a new show. It appears that Sasha was not slated to return.

evidences.name: Photo of the Body
evidences.description1: A crime scene photo taken in the orca pool room. It's hard to make out details of the body.
evidences.description2: Crime scene photos taken in the orca pool room. (2 photos.)

evidences.name: Orca Pool Diagram
evidences.description1: A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. The pool is about 65 feet deep.
evidences.description2: A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. Pearls apparently entered the staff corridor.
evidences.description3: It also has information about the area around the orca pool on the first and second floor. The pool is about 65 feet deep.

evidences.name: Whistle
evidences.description1: A whistle for issuing instructions to Orla. Anyone can use one to command her, as long as they know the right signals.
evidences.description2: Orla performs one trick per signal. She can't do two at a time.

evidences.name: Security Footage
evidences.description1: Video showing the orca pool from the visitor's corridor. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time.
evidences.description2: Video showing the orca pool. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. (2 pages.)

evidences.name: Fish
evidences.description1: A large quantity of fish for feeding Rifle the penguin. Not surprisingly, it has a horribly fishy smell!

evidences.name: Walkie-Talkie
evidences.description1: Issued to all aquarium staff for communication. It can apparently also be used to broadcast inside the aquarium.

evidences.name: Calendar
evidences.description1: A penguin-shaped calendar that Pearls bought at the aquarium. It smells fishy for some reason.
evidences.description2: Apparently belongs to Rimes. It was accidently [sic] switched with Pearls's calendar around 10:10 AM.
evidences.description3: Apparently belongs to Sasha. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th.
evidences.description4: It turns out this doesn't belong to Sasha. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th.
evidences.description5: A calendar that Azura Summers gave to Dr. Crab. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th.

evidences.name: Bloodstained Coin
evidences.description1: A single coin seems to have fallen by the side of the orca pool.
evidences.description2: Discovered by the side of the orca pool. There are 300 coins in all, weighing 7 pounds total. This makes it a likely murder weapon.

evidences.name: Swashbuckler Video
evidences.description1: A TV recording of a performance featuring Orla, Sasha and Jack Shipley as pirates.
evidences.description2: The show song on the video is different from the one DePlume heard.

evidences.name: TV Phone
evidences.description1: A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. This model can connect to TVs and be used to conduct teleconferencing.
evidences.description2: Summers's boyfriend has videos of her using a whistle to make the orca do tricks.
evidences.description3: A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. Videos of Summers can be viewed. (2 pages.)

evidences.name: Shipley's Autopsy Report → Shipley's Data
evidences.description1: Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body.
evidences.description2: Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body. Details updated.
evidences.description3: Shipley's walkie-talkie hasn't been found. (3 pages.)

evidences.name: "The Killer Killer Whale"
evidences.description1: A nonfiction book by Norma DePlume. It's about the case from last year.

evidences.name: Security Card
evidences.description1: A key card for gaining access to the orca pool. Only the victim and Sasha had one.

evidences.name: Prescription Bag
evidences.description1: Seized from Sasha's residence. She apparently had this filled at the Hickfield Clinic.

evidences.name: Skull Rock
evidences.description1: There's a bloodstain on the rock. The victim may have struck it when he fell to his death.
evidences.description2: A new show prop that was at the orca pool. The victim struck it when he fell.
evidences.description3: Moved from the show pool during cleaning time. The victim struck it when he fell to his death.
evidences.description4: The victim slammed into it when he fell. Orla also rammed into it. It had been moved from the show pool.

evidences.name: Pool Bottom Photo
evidences.description1: A photo of the bottom of the pool. The locations of the bloodstains detected with luminol are sketched in.

evidences.name: Mysterious Capsule → "3 Zs" Sleeping Pill
evidences.description1: The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. "3 Zs" is printed on it.
evidences.description2: The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. It's a sleeping pill, not some kind of poison.

evidences.name: Handmade Sign
evidences.description1: A sign Sasha made for the new show. It's been left to dry since the early hours of the 20th.

evidences.name: Ladder Prints
evidences.description1: The fingerprints discovered by Pearls at the show stage. They're Rimes's, but there's something odd about them.

evidences.name: Charm
evidences.description1: Discovered in Rifle's stomach. It might belong to Azura Summers's boyfriend.

evidences.name: TORPEDO Data
evidences.description1: TORPEDO data shows that Rifle ate around 4:00 AM on July 20th, but that Orla didn't eat anything.
